content:
An interview with Francis Fukuyama, the political scientist who coined the phrase, “the end of history”

The age of ideological struggle failed to end with the Cold War.  Francis Fukuyama, who coined the phrase “the end of history”, talks to Anne McElvoy about the rise of identity politics, whether there is any force that can rival it, and which party is playing the identity game better in the American midterms.  Music by Chris Zabriskie, “Divider” (CC by 4.0 UK)

ex: n. 分隔物；分开物；分线规；两脚规
网络 分配器；分规；除法器
eg2: a room divider(= a screen or door that divides a room into two parts)
房间分隔板（屏风或门）
a pair of dividers
一副分线规

ex: 网络 弗朗；法朗；刚果法郎

wp.ideological education: 思想教育;政治教育;思想政治教育;意识形态教育

ex: adj. 思想的；意识形态的
eg2: As to the ideological work， we should never go about impetuously.
对于思想工作， 千万不可操切从事。
In doing ideological work, one must suit one's methods to the situation.
做思想工作必须对症下药。
Despite their ideological problems, however, most of these protesters have been peaceful, which brings us to the next party to the drama that we certainly cannot cheer: the police.
虽然他们的意识形态有问题，但是，这些抗议者的绝大多数都是和平的，这就把我们带到这个事件中我们绝不赞赏的另一方：警察。

wp.Midterm election: 中期选举;期中选举;中期推举
wp.Midterm examination: 期中考试;期中考;期中随堂考试

eg2: PROF: Yes This is the indirect method but on the  it was the direct method STUDENT: But I am saying maintaining the order is important right?
教授：是的,这是间接法,但是关于期中考试,那是直接法,学生：但是我说,保持顺序很重要,对不对？
The war in Iraq was a predominant issue in the 2006 midterm elections, and Newport said it appears that it will continue to be the dominant issue during the next year.
在2006年的中期选举期间，伊拉克战争是占主导地位的问题。 纽波特说，看来这个问题在明年的选举中将继续成为压倒一切的问题。
The politically good news for Obama is that no matter what the outcome of the midterm elections, everything changes in January.
任何事情都将在一月份改变，不论中期选举是什么结果，这对奥巴马来说都是利好的消息。

ex: n. 短语, 习语, 措辞, 乐句
vt. 措词, 将(乐曲)分成乐句

wp.noun phrase: 名词短语;名词组;名词词组;名词片语
wp.Phrase Search: 短语检索;词组检索;短语搜索;词组搜索
wp.Phrase reading: 成组视读;组视读;意群阅读;短语阅读
wp.set phrase: 固定搭配;固定词组;成语;固定短语
wp.gerundial phrase: 动名词短语;动名词词组
wp.idiomatic phrase: 指常用的固定短语;如乱七八糟;熟语

eg2: He hashed a phrase in order to colour the sentence.
他反复推敲一个习语以使该句增色。
Sources differ in their speculation on where this phrase came from.
在猜测这个短语源自哪里时，资料并不一致。
It was in this note that he coined the phrase pop art.
正是在这封短笺中他创造了“波普艺术”这个短语。

Title: How are identity politics changing democracy?

paperStatistics.title: How are identity politics changing democracy?
paperStatistics.desc: An interview with Francis Fukuyama, the political scientist who coined the phrase, “the end of history”
